metadata.title: CVE-2015-6756 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the CPDFSDK_PageView implementation infpdfsdk/src/fsdk_mgr.cpp in PDFium, as used in Google Chrome before46.0.2490.71, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heapmemory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveragingmishandling of a focused annotation in a PDF document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6756` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106').
